column4: can someone explain why openoffice has a patch (that's about 100+ mb) each week?
then wouldnt it be better to just download openoffice from the main site and not worry about having to get the debs from the ubuntu servers, since they're so buggy and holey?
the .deb's from ubuntu are .deb made from the patches Openoffice puts out.
ah, ok. well, it just gets frusturating when we have bandwidth caps here in australia and we have 500 updates to get to make a distro stable
are you talking about because you have multiple machines to update or because openoffice updates so often?
are you using dapper or what?
been using gutsy for the longest time but gave up on doing updates about 3 months ago
thought this new hardy release candidate would have improved the update thing, but it didnt.
updates are tedious and stupid when they update apps i don't even use, and even if it's for security purposes, i'd rather just deal with a broken system than spend my uptime downloading updates
do you have "hardy" in your sources.list or "gutsy"?
How long have you had it like that DAC1138 ?
installed the hardy beta and im not installing anything else, since ubuntu is the best (just tried openoffice 10.3, it's not to shabby, but not ubuntu)
How long have you had it like that DAC1138 ?
hardy repos? since i installed the hardy RC
